connector.description: Render messages into PDF and other output formats supported by Apache FOP.

camel.sink.path.outputType.name: camel.sink.path.outputType
camel.sink.path.outputType.description: The primary output format is PDF but other output formats are also supported. One of: [pdf] [ps] [pcl] [png] [jpeg] [svg] [xml] [mif] [rtf] [txt]

camel.sink.endpoint.fopFactory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fopFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.fopFactory.description: Allows to use a custom configured or implementation of org.apache.fop.apps.FopFactory.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.userConfigURL.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userConfigURL
camel.sink.endpoint.userConfigURL.description: The location of a configuration file which can be loaded from classpath or file system.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.fop.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.fop.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.fop.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.fop.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.component.fop.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.fop.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
